intro: Dracophyllum × densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower drakophyllum, is a hybrid shrub native to the eastern coast of Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and coastal environments, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
